intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Ike! Ike! I’ve got to tell you something! Listen to this!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Settle down, Mist. It’s too early for you to be yelling like that. Now, what’s going on?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Soren’s back! He just arrived.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Really? That’s odd. He wasn’t supposed to return for a while yet.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: I know! I wonder what he’s doing back so soon...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: It’s probably nothing to worry about. I’ll go and talk to him. Where is he?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: In the mess hall. I think he wanted to talk to Father.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Right. I’ll go check there.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: ...Troubling news indeed. Gather the troops.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Yes, Commander.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Ike, if you’ve got time to waste, you’ve got time to work. Get over to the briefing room.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yes, sir.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Hey! What’s going on around here?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Bad news. Something big is happening, and we need to formulate a plan of action.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Soren!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Hello, Ike. Long time, no see.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I’m happy to see you’re back. But hat happened? I thought you were going to be studying for a while longer.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: It’s a long story...

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: What’s the hold up? Get over here now!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Let’s go. I’ll fill you in later.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: You probably remember that Soren’s been training with another mercenary group. Well, he’s back now. And he has some unbelievable news.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What news is that?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: It’s Crimea and Daein. They’ve gone to war.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: War?! It...It can’t be!

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: That’s why I’ve called everyone here. Soren has some more information. Go ahead, Soren.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: All right.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Take a look at this map.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Ah. It’s a map of Crimea. Quite detailed, from the looks of it.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Yes. This is the Melior, Crimea’s capital. Our base of operations is...

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Everything started three days ago. I needed to do some research, so I went to the archives of Melior’s royal library.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Without warning, the scream of a terrible beast–a wyvern, perhaps–rent the air, and the building was rocked by a tremor.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: I rushed outside and saw wave after wave of knights, cavalry, and wyvern riders, each clad in glistening ebon armor, black as night.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: The Daein army?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Correct.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Was there provocation?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: As you know, relations between Crimea and Daein have never been...friendly. However, the past centuries have seen only minor skirmishes, nothing that has ever approached the scale of this attack. It was brutal and without warning. Daein laid the capital to waste. I’ve never seen destruction on this scale before.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: A swift attack, devastating and brutal...A daring gambit, indeed.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: But if it succeeds, a very well-chosen one at that.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Yes, the king of Daein would not hesitate to employ such treacherous tactics. What happened next?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: King Crimea’s brother deployed the Crimean army to meet the attack. The king ordered his people to flee the city before the battle reached them. Fearing the worst, I also fled and made my way here.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: So we don’t know how the tides of battle flow now, do we?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: That’s all right. Word of the war cannot have traveled far yet. We may well be the first ones who know of it out here. You did well to bring us this information, Soren. I know some risk was involved.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: It was nothing.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Daein has invaded Crimea...We may be mercenaries, but this still affects us.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What are we going to do?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: That’s the question of the day. How do you see it, Titania?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Crimea is the closest thing our company has to a homeland The Crimean royal family and noble houses have been generous, providing us with many lucrative jobs. From a moral standpoint as well as a business one, it’s in our best interest to help Crimea.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: And you, Soren?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: I agree on one point: we are mercenaries.We are not Crimea’s private militia. No coin has crossed our palms, so I think we should stay out of it.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: So you would have us sit and watch as Crimea is overrun?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: I would. Daein’s troops are superior in both numbers and morale. The chances of a Crimean victory are slim indeed.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: But Crimea is ruled by King Ramon, who is known throughout the land for his wisdom. And his brother, Duke Renning, is said t possess peerless valor and courage. Daein may not find victory so easily.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Valor and courage are for children’s tales. In terms of military prowess, Daein’s King Ashnard is every bit Lord Renning’s equal. Victory will hinge on troop numbers and supplies, and Daein is superior in both. I think the outcome is painfully obvious.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Curse you, Soren! Crimea is not doomed! If they can turn aside Daein’s initial thrust and turn it into a test of endurance...

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: With the Crimean army both demoralized and ill prepared? They simply will not be able to hold out that long.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: All right. That’s enough. Both of you.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: I hear what you say. However, we must ascertain the current situation before we decide on any action. We’ll send a scouting party to get a closer look at Melior.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Ike, I want you in charge of this. Assemble your men and get going.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What? Me?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Titania will accompany you as an advisor.

intro.speaker: Shinon
intro.line: Commander, you must be joking! He’s just a boy, and he’s had barely more than a taste of battle. What do you expect a whelp like him to accomplish?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Ah, Shinon. Since you’re so concerned, you can go as well.

intro.speaker: Shinon
intro.line: Wait, that’s not what I...Blast.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Who else...Gatrie Rhys, and Soren. That should do.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Father, wait...Why do you want me–

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: That was an order. Get moving. There’s no time to waste.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yes, sir.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Titania, I’m going out for a bit. I want you to give Ike some direction.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Understood.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: ...Yes, sir.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Ike! Wait up!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Here! This is for you.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: A sword? Where did you get it?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: From Father. He told me to come and give it to you.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: It’s beautiful.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: This is the first sword you’ve gotten that wasn’t a hand-me-down from somebody, isn’t it? That’s great!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yeah...

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Well, be careful! Oh, and bring me a souvenir! Something nice. I’ve never been to Melior before...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Mist, I’m not going on vacation. Sheesh!

intro.speaker: Rhys
intro.line: Are you feeling all right, Ike? You haven’t said a word in quite some time.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I don’t understand what my father’s doing. Why put a new recruit like me in charge of something so important?

intro.speaker: Rhys
intro.line: You’re going to succeed him as our commander one day. Don’t you think he wants you to know how to lead?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Me? I don’t... I don’t know if I’m capable. And even if I am, that day’s a long way off, right? I mean, I’m inexperienced. Weak. I’m nothing compared to my father.

intro.speaker: Rhys
intro.line: I’m not so sure about that. When I look at you, I see a young man full of promise. Commander Greil is a great man, but...I think you’ll be every bit his equal.In time, you might even surpass him.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Don’t be ridiculous!

intro.speaker: Rhys
intro.line: It’s just my opinion. You need not pay it any mind. Yet, if you fear your own weakness, why not take this chance to go out and better yourself? That would be more in keeping with your personality, no?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I suppose you’re right.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: How did things look over there, Soren?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Same as here. There are corpses strewn everywhere. There are quite a lot of them, especially when you consider how far we are from the capital.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Are they Crimean?

intro.speaker: Rhys
intro.line: ...Judging by the armor, the vast majority of the dead are Daein soldiers.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So Crimea has the upper hand?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Just the opposite, I think. The Crimean soldiers were members of the Imperial Guard. That means King Ramon–or another member of the royal family–was on the move when Daein soldiers fell on them.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Could it have been Lord Renning?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: No. As long as the Crimean army still draws breath, Lord Renning will not leave their command. Perhaps another member of the court...

intro.speaker: Gatrie
intro.line: We’ve got Daein soldiers moving in on our location! And they don’t look happy!

intro.speaker: Maijin
intro.line: You there! Who are you? What are you doing here?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: We’re no one you need–

intro.speaker: Maijin
intro.line: You’re armed! Heed me! Drop your weapons and surrender! Act quickly, or else!

intro.speaker: Shinon
intro.line: Listen to me, fool. You’re making a mistake. We’re not...

intro.speaker: Maijin
intro.line: Ah, not going to cooperate, eh? Ready your weapons, men! Move in and kill them all!

intro.speaker: Maijin
intro.line: Tsk! Headstrong fools!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Getting caught up in some skirmish is not art of the plan...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: But they’re obviously not going to listen to us. Greil Mercenaries! Get ready to fight!

battle.speaker: Shinon
battle.line: All right, Ike. Let’s see how you handle the role of captain. Well? What are your orders, boy? We’ll do what you say, so long as you hurry up and spit it out!

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: I know, I know! I’m thinking! Give me a moment, will you, Shinon?

battle.speaker: Shinon
battle.line: Bah. Useless! We’d be better led with Mist than this soft, untested whelp.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Let’s see...We’re in the middle of the road, and there’s not much cover. Soren and Rhys are vulnerable, so we have to protect them from enemy attacks...Right?

battle.speaker: Soren
battle.line: That’s a sound strategy, Ike. I can attack from behind your defenses. Good thinking.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Do you mean that? Um...all right! Let’s do that then.

boss.speaker: Maijin
boss.line: Grrr! Blasted mercenaries. They’re better than I expected. Even so, they’ll not prove a match for Daein’s finest!

boss.speaker: Maijin
boss.line: Gwaa haa...Wretched curs...You will regret your decision to oppose Daein...

boss.speaker: Maijin
boss.line: Bah! You’re nothing more than a bunch of ragtag sellswords. Who are you to oppose Daein!? You are so terribly ignorant of your position in this world.

boss.speaker: Ike
boss.line: You refused to listen to us, and then you attacked without provocation! Is this the way of the Daein army?

boss.speaker: Maijin
boss.line: You’re a cheeky little monkey, aren’t you? Once you’re dead, you’ll regret sassing me!

boss.speaker: Maijin
boss.line: A mage, eh I’ll have to keep my guard up around you, no matter how young you look.

boss.speaker: Soren
boss.line: You forced this combat. We cannot allow you to return home. Are you ready to die?

boss.speaker: Maijin
boss.line: I’ve fought the Crimean army before. The Imperial Guard has some skill, but the rest are a poor joke. Which will you prove to be? Hmm? Perhaps you’ll offer me some entertainment after all.

boss.speaker: Titania
boss.line: If you attacked us because you thought we were with the Crimean army, you made a mistake. I left my post years ago. Now, I’m nothing more than a common mercenary.

boss.speaker: Maijin
boss.line: That means nothing to me. You’re not of Daein, you’re armed, and you’re here. It’s our job to destroy you. Simple, wouldn’t you say? Come, dog! Prepare yourself!

boss.speaker: Titania
boss.line: I’d just as soon avoid this bloodshed, but that seems unlikely. If that’s the way it is, I’ll not hold back!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Did we suffer any casualties?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Any wounded or dead? No? Excellent! Well done!

end.speaker: Gatrie
end.line: I don’t know...Taking out these Daein soldiers may have been a bad move. Um...Hey, Shinon? What are you doing?

end.speaker: Shinon
end.line: This swine’s got some nice weapons. Besides, he ain’t gonna complain. He won’t need them where he’s going.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Shinon!

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Get ahold of yourself! We can’t afford such behavior right now. Steal from the dead on your own time.

end.speaker: Shinon
end.line: What? You judgmental little–

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Soren! Shinon! Stop this at once! This is no place for us to waste time bickering amongst ourselves!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Let’s clear out of here. We have to tell the commander what happened.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Let’s take this road. We should be able to cut through the forest and...Huh?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Something wrong?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: No, as I said, this road...

end.speaker: Rhys
end.line: Wait! Ike, I just saw something move on the far side of that thicket!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: A wounded soldier, perhaps? Let’s go have a look. Careful, now.

end.speaker: Rhys
end.line: Oh, no...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Did you find anything, Rhys?

end.speaker: Rhys
end.line: ...It’s a woman...

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Leave her. We shouldn’t get involved in matters that don’t concern us.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Oooh...

end.speaker: Rhys
end.line: Thank goodness...It looks like she’s merely fainted.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Right. We’d better take her with us for now and make sure she’s all right. Give me a hand, will you, Rhys?

end.speaker: Rhys
end.line: Of course.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: ...I don’t like this...
